channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Letitia James Case Shows Ruthlessness of Justice Dept. in Trump’s Grip
item.description: For the Trump administration, creating an aura of criminality around the indicted New York attorney general — through public scrutiny of her and her r...

item.title: Trump Official Warns California Against Arresting Federal Agents
item.description: Deputy U.S. Attorney General Todd Blanche told top California leaders that they would be prosecuted if they arrested federal agents performing immigra...

item.title: The Peril of a White House That Flaunts Its Indifference to the Law
item.description: The White House has made no legal argument explaining its bald claim that the president has wartime power to summarily kill people suspected of smuggl...

item.title: Trump shutting down trade talks with Canada could give Beijing another advantage
item.description: If Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney has any frustrations he wants to share about his southern neighbor, he could do so with China's President Xi as...

item.title: CEO of IT firm with 350K workers says AI will create more entry level jobs—and he’s recruiting liberal arts graduates
item.description: Ravi Kumar S of Cognizant Technology Solutions says AI will widen the base of corporate employment and ‘the path to expertise is going to be faster.’

item.title: Term Sheet Next: Jessica Powell on how AI unlocks the massive enterprise audio market
item.description: Jessica Powell’s AudioShake, already with more than 40 enterprise customers, recently raised its $14 million seed round, led by Shine Capital.

item.title: Cambricon a.k.a. ‘China’s Nvidia’ says revenue spiked 14-fold last quarter. The ensuing stock frenzy made its CEO one of the world’s richest people
item.description: Chen Tianshi is the 40-year-old founder and CEO of Beijing-based Cambricon, an AI chip company that posted a monster earnings report last week.

item.title: Simon Sinek says the most successful people in the world ‘hit zero’ or came close to it: Failure is ‘the gift’
item.description: Failure is an essential prerequisite for success, research shows.

item.title: So Long, East Wing
item.description: We look back at the history of this corner of the White House.

item.title: On a Roll, European Leaders Meet to Bolster Support for Ukraine
item.description: Britain, the host, is framing a meeting of the “coalition of the willing” as an effort to fortify Kyiv for the winter fighting months.

item.title: Trump Official Warns California Against Arresting Federal Agents
item.description: Deputy U.S. Attorney General Todd Blanche told top California leaders that they would be prosecuted if they arrested federal agents performing immigra...

item.title: On a Roll, European Leaders Meet to Bolster Support for Ukraine
item.description: Britain, the host, is framing a meeting of the “coalition of the willing” as an effort to fortify Kyiv for the winter fighting months.

item.title: Who Were the Palestinian Prisoners Freed by Israel?
item.description: Under the cease-fire deal, Israel released 250 Palestinians serving long sentences for violent attacks. More than 1,700 others had been detained in Ga...

item.title: Rebuilding Israeli-Held Parts of Gaza: Workable or Another U.S. Pipe Dream?
item.description: There are many questions about whether the idea is feasible or doomed from the outset.

item.title: Blue Jays Face Dodgers in World Series With All of Canada Behind Them
item.description: The Blue Jays and the Dodgers play Game 1 of the World Series tonight, and for Canada’s team home-field advantage is as big as the entire country.
